definition: to hold/to carry (in one's arms)/to hug/to embrace/to surround/to cherish
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be

sentences.english: The world should not be prejudiced and jealous.
sentences.chinese: 世界不应抱有偏见和嫉妒。

sentences.english: We should come to the problem with an open mind.
sentences.chinese: 我们处理这个问题时不应抱有偏见。

sentences.english: The Vietnamese have no illusions about Beijing's readiness to provoke.
sentences.chinese: 越南人对北京可能的挑衅并不抱有幻想。

sentences.english: Don't let her insults bias you against your husband.
sentences.chinese: 别让她的辱骂使你对你丈夫抱有偏见。

sentences.english: The boss has a bias against female applicants.
sentences.chinese: 老板对女性求职者抱有偏见。

sentences.english: Teachers tend to have stereotyped opinions about naughty pupils.
sentences.chinese: 教师往往对调皮学生抱有成见。

sentences.english: My ignorance biased me against popular music.
sentences.chinese: 我由于无知而对流行音乐抱有偏见。

sentences.english: I always take a negative view towards marrying for money.
sentences.chinese: 我一直对为金钱而结婚的行为抱有成见。

sentences.english: The study says that British advertisements stereotype women.
sentences.chinese: 该项研究显示英国的广告对妇女抱有成见。

sentences.english: These days everyone is disenchanted with civic institutions and government.
sentences.chinese: 如今，人们不再对民间机构和政府抱有幻想。

sentences.english: The study says that British marketing crevaigns stereotype women.
sentences.chinese: 该项研究说，英国的广告对妇女抱有成见。

sentences.english: His experiences bias him against businessmen.
sentences.chinese: 他的经历使他对商人抱有偏见。

sentences.english: She wouldn't hold it against you that you have let her down once before.
sentences.chinese: 你以前曾使她失望这件事不会使她对你抱有成见。

sentences.english: This year our team heads for the Hungarian Grand Prix with muted expectations.
sentences.chinese: 今年，车队并没有对匈牙利大奖赛抱有太大的期望。

sentences.english: His birth background biases him against businessmen.
sentences.chinese: 他出生的家庭背景使他对商人抱有偏见。

sentences.english: That would most certainly tend to prejudice country-born people against him .
sentences.chinese: 这就必然使乡下人对他抱有成见。

definition: to hold in storage/to retain/to harbor (feelings)/to entertain (sentiments)/(of abstract things) to exist/there is
to have in one's person (feelings, talent etc)
to place (hope, importance etc) on/to express/to show/to give
an extravagant hope/to have excessive expectations
to dispel (doubts, misgivings etc)/to give up on
